metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4049 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The bgp_dump_routes_func function in bgpd/bgp_dump.c in Quagga does not perform size checks when dumping data, which might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemon crash) via a large BGP packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

quagga - 0.99.24.1-2ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> as of 2016-09-15, upstream hasn't commited the proposed patch debian released update with proposed patch

criterions.comment: quagga package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.24.1-2ubuntu1.1').
